content: Provide 2 or 3 instances of parallelism within The Gettysburg Address by Abraham Lincoln.

chosen:
Here are two examples of parallelism in the Gettysburg Address:

"Fourscore and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent a new nation, conceived in liberty and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal."
"Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth."
rejected:
Here are two examples of parallel construction in the Gettysburg Address:

"Eighty-seven years ago, when this nation was young and small, a band of patriots declared that they were "not willing to live under a government of men," but that they were "determined to form a government of laws."

"Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth."
snaprejected:
Here are two examples of parallel construction in the Gettysburg Address:

"Eighty-seven years ago, when this nation was young and small, a band of patriots declared that they were "not willing to live under a government of men," but that they were "determined to form a government of laws."

"Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth."
snapchosen:
Here are two examples of parallel construction from the Gettysburg Address:

"Fourscore and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent a new nation, conceived in liberty and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal."
"Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth."

content: Can you add on instances of antithesis in this same speech?

chosen:
Certainly! Here are two examples of antithesis in the Gettysburg Address:

"government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth" - This phrase is an example of antithesis because it contrasts the idea of a government that is run by the people with the idea of a government that is run by a small elite.

"a new nation, conceived in liberty and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal" - This phrase is also an example of antithesis because it contrasts the idea of a new nation with the idea of a nation that has existed for a long time. It also contrasts the idea of liberty with the idea of equality.
rejected:
Certainly! Here is an example of antithesis in the Gettysburg Address:

"Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth." This sentence contains a contrast between the idea of a government of the people, which is supported by the people, and a government for the people, which is not. The use of "shall not perish" emphasizes the importance of the principle of self-governance.
